Title: Morgan Stanley nears deal to pay less than $500 mln to resolve trading probe -source
Short Description: Morgan Stanley is nearing a deal to pay less than $500 million to resolve a government probe into its handling of big stock sales, according to a source with knowledge of the matter.

Title: Morgan Stanley promotes 155 employees to managing directors -source
Short Description: Morgan Stanley promoted 155 employees to become managing directors this year, fewer than its 2023 cohort of 184, said a person familiar with the situation who declined to be identified discussing personnel matters.

Title: Morgan Stanley's straight-talking new CEO Ted Pick taking charge
Short Description: When Ted Pick takes over as the new CEO of Morgan Stanley next week, the three-decade bank veteran's frank manner and steady hand will help him steer the firm through a dealmaking slump.

Title: Morgan Stanley's outgoing CEO says markets will take off after rate cuts- FT
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's outgoing CEO James Gorman said financial markets will "take off" once investors are sure the Federal Reserve has finished raising interest rates, the Financial Times reported on Friday.

Title: Morgan Stanley's Andy Saperstein diagnosed with cancer - memo
Short Description: Morgan Stanley co-President Andy Saperstein has been diagnosed with cancer, he wrote in an internal memo seen by Reuters on Tuesday.

Title: Morgan Stanley appoints Jed Finn as head of wealth management - memo
Short Description: Morgan Stanley has named Jed Finn as the head of its wealth management unit, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Monday.

Title: Morgan Stanley sees S&P 500 ending 2024 at 4,500
Short Description: Morgan Stanley said on Monday it expects the S&P 500 to end 2024 at 4,500, and predicted earnings recovery through the year.

Title: US Fed probes Morgan Stanley's international wealth-management practices - WSJ
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's wealth management is being scrutinized by the U.S. Federal Reserve, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday citing people familiar with the matter.

Title: Morgan Stanley’s new CEO inherits rich pickings
Short Description: Ted Pick’s appointment as chief executive of Morgan Stanley is Wall Street finance’s equivalent of a chart-topping band working on a difficult second album. He inherits a firm that’s generously valued by investors, amply profitable, and has only just fully digested two large acquisitions. When it comes to future deals, Pick has a tough act to follow. He also, though, has time.

Title: Morgan Stanley may pay up to $1 bln to resolve US probe into private stock sales - Semafor
Short Description: Morgan Stanley may pay between $500 million and $1 billion to resolve a long-running U.S. probe into how it handled private stock sales, Semafor reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Title: Morgan Stanley may pay $1 bln to resolve US probe into private stock sales - Semafor
Short Description: Morgan Stanley may pay as much as $1 billion to resolve a long-running U.S. probe into how it handled private stock sales, Semafor reported on Tuesday. (Reporting by Niket Nishant in Bengaluru; Editing by Anil D'Silva)

Title: Morgan Stanley gives next CEO Ted Pick and two top execs $20 mln awards
Short Description: Morgan Stanley gave its next CEO Ted Pick and the other two contenders for the top job one-time awards worth about $20 million each, the bank said in a filing on Friday.

Title: Morgan Stanley to pay one-time stock awards for its top three executives
Short Description: Morgan Stanley on Friday disclosed it would pay one-time stock awards to three top executives, including incoming CEO Ted Pick.

Title: Morgan Stanley CEO shift pleases all, thrills none
Short Description: Wall Street has served up its share of chaotic and ill-starred leadership transitions over the years. So the crushing conventionality of Morgan Stanley’s new chief executive selection, announced late on Wednesday, is almost certainly the point.

Title: Morgan Stanley's Pick and Gorman talk succession, strategy and challenges
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's current CEO James Gorman and incoming CEO Ted Pick spoke with Reuters about the company's leadership succession and strategy. Here are some quotes from the interview:

Title: Five facts about Morgan Stanley's new CEO Ted Pick
Short Description: Morgan Stanley chose Ted Pick to succeed its longtime leader James Gorman as CEO, effective Jan. 1.

Title: Morgan Stanley's 14 years under James Gorman: a timeline
Short Description: Morgan Stanley on Wednesday named insider Ted Pick as its next chief executive officer, replacing longtime leader James Gorman, who will become the investment bank's executive chairman.

Title: TIMELINE-Morgan Stanley's 14 years under James Gorman: a timeline
Short Description: Morgan Stanley on Wednesday named insider Ted Pick as its chief executive officer, replacing long-time leader James Gorman, who will become the investment bank's executive chairman. Here is a timeline of key events that shaped Gorman's almost 14-year tenure at the Wall Street...

Title: Morgan Stanley's Ted Pick to take helm as CEO from James Gorman
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's newly chosen CEO, insider Ted Pick, on Wednesday pledged to keep the bank focused on investment banking and wealth management as he takes the Wall Street powerhouse into a new era, succeeding veteran banker James Gorman.

Title: Morgan Stanley names Ted Pick as CEO
Short Description: Morgan Stanley on Wednesday named Ted Pick as its new chief executive officer. (Reporting by Manya Saini in Bengaluru; Editing by Anil D'Silva)

Title: Morgan Stanley profit beats on wealth management strength
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's third-quarter profit dropped less than expected as a strong performance in the bank's wealth management division offset a hit from lethargic dealmaking.

Title: Morgan Stanley profit shrinks as deal slump lingers
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's profit fell in the third quarter, dragged down by lethargic dealmaking.

Title: Banks stocks back in vogue for hedge funds in September -Morgan Stanley
Short Description: Global hedge funds raced to load up on bullish positions in banks, insurance companies and capital markets as September drew to a close, Morgan Stanley said in a client note, catching a tailwind for the financial sector from higher interest rates.

Title: Morgan Stanley sued for $750 mln by lenders to rail line, who claim fraud
Short Description: Morgan Stanley was sued on Monday for at least $750 million by private equity firms that claimed they were defrauded in an investment with a high-speed rail company.

Title: Morgan Stanley to launch AI chatbot to woo wealthy
Short Description: Wealthy clients going to a Morgan Stanley financial adviser to discuss their investments may have a different sort of experience in the future: having a chatbot listen to their conversation.

Title: FOCUS-Morgan Stanley to launch AI chatbot to woo wealthy
Short Description: Wealthy clients going to a Morgan Stanley banker to discuss their investments may soon have a different sort of experience: having a chatbot listen to their conversation.

Title: MOVES-Morgan Stanley hires Kagan from Citi for structured M&A -sources
Short Description: Morgan Stanley has hired Michael Kagan from Citigroup Inc to drive the bank's efforts on structured mergers and acquisitions (M&A), including spin-offs and separation deals, people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Title: Morgan Stanley and MUFG’s next act is well-timed
Short Description: A Wall Street stalwart and Japan’s biggest bank by market value on Tuesday unveiled the second act of a 15-year alliance that has established itself as the envy of its peers. Morgan Stanley and the $94 billion Mitsubishi UFJ Financial are tapping deeper into a good thing at the right time.

Title: Morgan Stanley moves 200 technologists out of China on data law - Bloomberg News
Short Description: Morgan Stanley is shifting more than 200 technology developers out of China after the country tightened access to cache of data stored onshore, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Title: Morgan Stanley profit drops 14% as deal drought persists
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's profit slipped 14% in the second quarter from a year earlier as a deal-making slump persisted, while trading in stocks and bonds weakened.

Title: Morgan Stanley profit drops 18% as deal doldrums persist
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's profit slipped 18% in the second quarter as Wall Street's deal-making drought stunted revenue from investment banking.

Title: MUFG, Morgan Stanley to deepen alliance, merge some Japan operations
Short Description: Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG) and Morgan Stanley said on Tuesday they will deepen their 15-year old alliance by combining some operations at their Japanese brokerage joint ventures.

Title: UPDATE 1-MUFG, Morgan Stanley to collaborate on forex trading, Japan equity research
Short Description: Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG) and Morgan Stanley said on Tuesday they will collaborate on foreign exchange trading and in the Japanese research and equity businesses for institutional clients.

Title: MUFG, Morgan Stanley to collaborate on forex trading, Japan equity research
Short Description: Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group and Morgan Stanley said on Tuesday they would collaborate on foreign exchange trading and in the Japanese research and equity businesses for institutional clients.

Title: Morgan Stanley hires healthcare services banker Cohen from Truist
Short Description: Morgan Stanley has hired veteran investment banker Daniel Cohen from Truist Financial Corp , where he was the head of the firm's healthcare services advisory business, a person familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Title: BRIEF-Morgan Stanley International Bank (China) Ltd Received Approval From Chinese Regulator To Open Derivative Trading Business In China
Short Description: * MORGAN STANLEY: MORGAN STANLEY INTERNATIONAL BANK (CHINA) LTD RECEIVED APPROVAL FROM CHINESE REGULATOR TO OPEN DERIVATIVE TRADING BUSINESS IN CHINA (Reporting by Beijing Newsroom)

Title: Exclusive: Morgan Stanley board considers next CEO while Gorman clears the decks
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's board will focus on the selection of CEO James Gorman's successor at its summer and fall meetings, a person familiar with the situation said, while the outgoing boss looks to clear the decks by resolving major regulatory matters.

Title: Spartan Capital broker faces probe tied to deals advised by Morgan Stanley, Wall Street Journal reports
Short Description: Federal prosecutors are investigating whether a broker at Spartan Capital Securities traded on confidential information about planned mergers and acquisitions illegally obtained from Morgan Stanley , the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

Title: Broker at Spartan Capital Securities faces insider-trading probe tied to Morgan Stanley - WSJ
Short Description: Federal prosecutors in Manhattan are investigating whether a securities broker at Spartan Capital Securities traded on confidential information illegally obtained from Morgan Stanley, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.

Title: Morgan Stanley CEO sees deals in asset management
Short Description: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman said the bank could look for more deals in asset management.

Title: Veteran Morgan Stanley dealmaker Rob Kindler to join law firm
Short Description: Rob Kindler, a top executive at Morgan Stanley , is leaving the investment bank after a 17-year stint to join a major law firm.

Title: Morgan Stanley sees slump in US earnings in 2023, sharp rebound next year
Short Description: Morgan Stanley warns of a 16% drop in profit for S&P 500 companies this year, followed by a sharp rebound in 2024 when analysts say the Federal Reserve's policy will become more accommodative.

Title: UPDATE 1-European equities could correct 10% over summer - Morgan Stanley
Short Description: European equities could fall by 10% over the summer as slowing economic growth and deteriorating liquidity dampens earnings, Morgan Stanley said on Monday.

Title: European equities could correct 10% over summer - Morgan Stanley
Short Description: European equities could fall by 10% over the summer as slowing economic growth and deteriorating liquidity dampens earnings, Morgan Stanley said on Monday.

Title: Morgan Stanley expects trading, investment banking results to weaken
Short Description: Morgan Stanley expects its revenue from trading and investment banking to slump in the second quarter given a more challenging economic environment, co-president Andy Saperstein told investors Wednesday.

Title: Morgan Stanley CEO succession underscores Wall Street's diversity gap
Short Description: Women were less represented in leadership positions at Morgan Stanley than at other top U.S. banks, data show.

Title: Morgan Stanley's Aussie CEO Gorman transformed bank, deal by deal
Short Description: When James Gorman made one of the biggest announcements of his career on Friday -- that he would be stepping down as Morgan Stanley CEO within a year -- he still managed to crack a joke.

Title: Factbox: Morgan Stanley's three potential CEO candidates
Short Description: Morgan Stanley will likely appoint its next CEO in the next 12 months, its current Chief Executive James Gorman said on Friday.

Title: Instant View: Morgan Stanley CEO Gorman plans to step down
Short Description: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman told shareholders Friday that the company will likely appoint its next CEO in the next 12 months.

Title: Morgan Stanley CEO Gorman to hand reins to successor within a year
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's James Gorman plans to step down as chief executive within a year but stay on as executive chairman, drawing to a close 13 years in the role during which he built the Wall Street firm into a wealth management powerhouse.

Title: Morgan Stanley weighs cutting 7% of Asia investment bank jobs-source
Short Description: Morgan Stanley is considering a 7% cut in its Asia-Pacific investment banking workforce, or about 40 jobs, according to a source with direct knowledge of the matter.

Title: Morgan Stanley to increase Paris staff to 500 by 2025
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's plan to increase headcount in France by 200 by 2025 would bring its total staff in the country to 500, with the new Paris-based bankers mostly devoted to sales and trading of so-called macro products and stock derivatives.

Title: Morgan Stanley in talks to resolve probes into block trading practices
Short Description: Morgan Stanley is looking to resolve more than a year long investigation by U.S. regulators into its block trading practices, the Wall Street bank said in a filing on Tuesday.

Title: Morgan Stanley to cut 3,000 jobs in second quarter
Short Description: Morgan Stanley is planning to eliminate about 3,000 jobs in the second quarter, a source told Reuters on Monday, in its second round of job cuts in six months.

Title: Morgan Stanley to cut 3,000 jobs in second quarter
Short Description: Morgan Stanley is planning to eliminate about 3,000 jobs in the second quarter, a source told Reuters on Monday, in its second round of job cuts in six months.

Title: Morgan Stanley's dealmaking CEO Gorman signals more transactions to come
Short Description: Morgan Stanley plans to buy more wealth and asset management businesses and is keeping an eye on potential targets, CEO James Gorman said on Wednesday.

Title: Morgan Stanley first-quarter profit falls as mega deals dry up
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's first-quarter profit fell as its mainstay investment banking business remained under pressure due to a prolonged slump in dealmaking.

Title: UPDATE 1-Morgan Stanley wins nod to fully own Chinese fund venture
Short Description: Morgan Stanley said on Friday its asset management unit has received Chinese regulatory approval to take full ownership of a China mutual fund venture, marking a key step toward broadening its footprint in the world's second-biggest economy.

Title: China approves Morgan Stanley as actual controller of Chinese JV
Short Description: Morgan Stanley has received China securities regulator's approval to be the actual controller of its Chinese fund management firm Morgan Stanley Huaxin Fund Management Co Ltd (MSHF), the regulator said on Friday.

Title: Morgan Stanley board cuts CEO Gorman's total compensation for 2022 to $31.5 mln
Short Description: Morgan Stanley Chief Executive Officer James Gorman's total compensation for 2022 slipped 10% to $31.5 million, the bank said on Friday.

Title: Morgan Stanley's Gorman says inflation has peaked - CNBC
Short Description: Morgan Stanley Chief Executive Officer James Gorman said on Thursday that inflation had clearly peaked, but wondered whether the U.S. Federal Reserve could get it to 2%.

Title: Morgan Stanley comfortable on headcount, takes mark-to-market losses on Twitter
Short Description: Morgan Stanley is comfortable with its headcount after recent action to reduce jobs in December, Chief Financial Officer Sharon Yeshaya told Reuters on Tuesday.

Title: Morgan Stanley beats quarterly profit estimates
Short Description: Morgan Stanley beat analysts' estimates for fourth-quarter profit on Tuesday as the investment bank's trading business got a boost from market volatility, offsetting the hit from sluggish dealmaking.

Title: Morgan Stanley managing directors' list has record proportion of women -source
Short Description: Morgan Stanley has promoted 184 executives to the role of managing directors this year, lower than 199 a year earlier, but list included a record proportion of women, according to a person familiar with the matter. Among the newly promoted executives, 38% of the 2023 managing...

Title: Morgan Stanley COO Jon Pruzan exits firm - Bloomberg News
Short Description: Morgan Stanley Chief Operating Officer Jon Pruzan has exited the investment bank, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing an internal message.

Title: Two equity bankers lose their Morgan Stanley broker licenses -regulator
Short Description: Two Morgan Stanley equity syndicate bankers, Pawan Passi and Charles Leisure, are no longer listed as registered brokers at the Wall Street firm, according to industry regulator FINRA's website.

Title: Morgan Stanley cuts about 2% of its workforce - source
Short Description: Morgan Stanley has cut about 2% of its workforce on Tuesday, according to a source familiar with the company's plans.

Title: Morgan Stanley profit falls as deals drought extends
Short Description: Morgan Stanley on Friday reported a drop in third-quarter profit, as a slowdown in global dealmaking hurt the investment bank's core underwriting business.

Title: Morgan Stanley revises rate call on India's RBI to 50 bps on sticky inflation
Short Description: The Reserve Bank of India could raise interest rates by 50 basis points at its upcoming policy review, thanks to stubbornly high inflation and the pace at which major global central banks are hiking rates, Morgan Stanley said.

Title: Morgan Stanley reaches agreements to resolve SEC, CFTC investigations
Short Description: Morgan Stanley said on Friday it had reached agreements with two regulatory agencies to resolve record-keeping investigations about business communications on messaging platforms not approved by the bank.

Title: MEDIA-Morgan Stanley SPAC banker Bennett Schachter exits for Elliott- Bloomberg News
Short Description: -- Note: Reuters has not verified this story and does not vouch for its accuracy

Title: Morgan Stanley second-quarter profit falls
Short Description: Morgan Stanley on Thursday reported a drop in second-quarter profit, as dealmaking slumped amid soaring market volatility and dented the firm's investment banking unit.

Title: Morgan Stanley discloses regulators' request for business communications records -filing
Short Description: Morgan Stanley disclosed in a filing on Wednesday that it is responding to "requests for information from regulators concerning its compliance with record-keeping requirements."

Title: Morgan Stanley profit falls on trading slowdown
Short Description: Morgan Stanley reported a drop in first-quarter profit on Thursday as trading revenue fell from last year's highs.

Title: Investment firm files demand for arbitration against Morgan Stanley - WSJ
Short Description: Disruptive Technology Solutions LLC and affiliated funds have filed a demand for arbitration against Wall Street bank Morgan Stanley with the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority, the Wall Street Journal reported https://www.wsj.com/articles/investment-firm-files-finra-arbitration-demand-against-morgan-stanley...

Title: MOVES-Morgan Stanley's chief sustainability officer to retire - memo
Short Description: Morgan Stanley Chief Sustainability Officer Audrey Choi is set to retire from her role and become a senior adviser, the company said in an internal memo seen by Reuters on Wednesday.

Title: Morgan Stanley doubles quarterly dividend, increases share buyback
Short Description: Morgan Stanley said on Monday it had doubled its quarterly dividend to 70 cents per share.

Title: Morgan Stanley CEO to staff: Be back at New York headquarters by September
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's (MS.N) chief executive officer said on Monday that if most employees are not back to work at the bank's Manhattan headquarters in September, he will be "very disappointed."

Title: Morgan Stanley appoints E*Trade leaders to top wealth division jobs
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N) appointed several executives from E*Trade to senior roles on Wednesday in a leadership shuffle that brings leaders from the online broker into the top ranks of the firm's wealth management division, according to a memo seen by Reuters.

Title: MOVES Morgan Stanley hires ex BofA banker Rizzo to drive European client push - sources
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N) has hired former Bank of America (BAC.N) banker Luigi Rizzo for a new client-facing role overseeing a drive to win business from a wide spectrum of companies across Europe, the Middle East and Africa (EMEA), sources familiar with the move told Reuters.

Title: Federer-backed shoe firm ON Running targets autumn IPO -sources
Short Description: Shoe firm ON Running, backed by Swiss tennis star Roger Federer, is preparing for a U.S. stock market listing as early as this autumn in a deal valuing the firm at about $5 billion, people close to the matter said.

Title: Morgan Stanley nears full ownership of China ventures with stake buys
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N) is buying stakes put up for sale by its partner in their China securities and mutual funds joint ventures for about $150 million, according to a statement by the partner, moving towards full ownership of the businesses.

Title: EXCLUSIVE Morgan Stanley closing Indonesian onshore equities business
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N)is closing its Indonesian onshore institutional equities trading business, the investment bank said on Thursday in response to queries from Reuters.

Title: EXCLUSIVE Morgan Stanley says to close Indonesian onshore equities business
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N) plans to close its Indonesian onshore institutional equities trading business, the investment bank said on Thursday in response to Reuters queries.

Title: Morgan Stanley boss acknowledges slow progress on diversity
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's (MS.N) efforts to improve the diversity of its workforce and senior management have not proceeded as quickly as Chief Executive James Gorman would have liked, he said in prepared testimony posted on Tuesday.

Title: Wall Street bank CEOs to tout COVID relief push, diversity efforts before Congress
Short Description: Wall Street bank chiefs will tout the role their institutions have played in getting the pandemic-hit U.S. economy back on track when they appear before Congress this week, but are likely to face tough questions on hot-button social and economic issues.

Title: After M&A boom via Zoom, dealmakers hit the road as COVID-19 subsides
Short Description: Investment bankers' business of putting together mergers and acquisitions (M&A) has never been stronger. Neither has their fear of missing out on meeting clients.

Title: Australia's Westpac breaks bond hiatus with $2.8 bln deal
Short Description: Westpac Banking Group (WBC.AX) on Tuesday reopened Australia's big banks bond-market taps for the first time in more than a year, with a $2.75 billion deal that also marked their first use of a non-USD Libor benchmark rate to price the debt.

Title: Capital Calls: Morgan Stanley’s stars realign
Short Description: Concise insights on global finance.

Title: Morgan Stanley CEO shakes up leadership in search for successor
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N) announced a slew of leadership changes on Thursday, firing the starting gun on the competition to replace Chief Executive Officer James Gorman in the coming years.

Title: Wells Fargo to onboard active cryptocurrency strategy for rich clients
Short Description: Wells Fargo & Co said on Wednesday its investment institute is planning to evaluate and onboard an actively managed cryptocurrency strategy for its wealthy clients, the latest move by a major U.S. bank toward accepting digital currencies.

Title: For LNG developers, another year of canceled projects
Short Description: This week's decision by Australia's Woodside Petroleum Ltd (WPL.AX) to pull out of a big Canadian liquefied natural gas (LNG) project was the latest blow to a sector that has been heralded for its growth prospects worldwide.

Title: Siemens Energy says it has no plans for full Siemens Gamesa takeover
Short Description: Siemens Energy (ENR1n.DE) said on Tuesday it has no current plans to buy the one third of wind turbine maker Siemens Gamesa (SGREN.MC) it does not already own, denying a Spanish newspaper report it had engaged banks to help it make such a move.

Title: ValueAct exits Morgan Stanley stake, trims other financial firms in Q1-filing
Short Description: Investment firm ValueAct liquidated its stake in Morgan Stanley (MS.N) and trimmed holdings in Citigroup Inc (C.N), KKR & Co Inc (KKR.N) and SLM Corp (SLM.O) in early 2021, pointing to a shift away from some financial firms that it has owned for several years, a regulatory filing released on Monday showed.

Title: Japan's top bank MUFG forecasts lower credit costs, beats profit view
Short Description: Japan's top lender Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc (MUFG) (8306.T) posted on Monday a better than expected 47% jump in annual profit and forecast its credit costs will fall this year on expectations of a recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Title: EXCLUSIVE Personal finance startup NerdWallet files for U.S. IPO -sources
Short Description: NerdWallet Inc, the owner of the eponymous consumer financial advice website, has confidentially submitted paperwork to U.S. regulators for an initial public offering (IPO), people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

Title: Morgan Stanley cautions against Chinese ADRs as delisting looms
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N) cautioned on Friday against exposure to U.S.-listed Chinese tech firms after the U.S. accounting watchdog moved a step closer to removing non-compliant Chinese companies from American exchanges.

Title: Reckitt shortlists bidders for $2bln Mead Johnson China business -sources
Short Description: British consumer goods company Reckitt Benckiser Group (RKT.L) has shortlisted bidders including Bain Capital, Carlyle Group (CG.O) and dairy producer Yili to submit binding offers for its Greater China infant formula business, sources said.

Title: EXCLUSIVE Fed privately presses big banks on risks from climate change
Short Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve has asked lenders to start providing information on the measures they are taking to mitigate climate change-related risks to their balance sheets, according to four people with knowledge of the matter.

Title: Bankers quit London as Brexit relocations to EU step up
Short Description: Investment banks are shifting more rainmakers out of London to financial centres across the European Union, accelerating the pace of moves after the pandemic and uncertainty over Britain's access to the bloc slowed relocations.

Title: Factbox: Bitcoin's march towards the mainstream
Short Description: Bitcoin  hit a record high just shy of $65,000 last month, the latest landmark on its march to wider acceptance. A growing embrace by major companies and financial firms, particularly in the United States, have fuelled its gains.

Title: China’s Didi Chuxing to take 3.1% of passenger ride fees as profit
Short Description: Chinese ride-hailing giant Didi Chuxing, which is backed by SoftBank (9984.T), Alibaba  and Tencent (0700.HK), said on Friday that 3.1% of passenger fees for rides will go towards its profit last year.

Title: Goldman Sachs offers bitcoin derivatives to investors- Bloomberg News
Short Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS.N) is allowing Wall Street investors to trade with a derivative tied to bitcoin prices, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.

Title: Column: German Greens shifting market calculus: Mike Dolan
Short Description: Five months is a long time in German politics but a mould-breaking surge in support for the Green party ahead of September's Federal election has markets crunching numbers to assess its likely role in the next ruling coalition.

Title: Former Woowa owners sell stake in Germany's Delivery Hero
Short Description: The former owners of Woowa Brothers are selling shares worth about 1.25 billion euros ($1.5 billion) in Delivery Hero (DHER.DE), which they received as part of the German online takeaway food company's 2019 acquisition of the South Korean food delivery app.

Title: Analysis: Pound’s post-Brexit calm may face Scottish independence test
Short Description: The pound, enjoying a period of calm after 4-1/2 years of Brexit-linked chaos, may suffer some turmoil if an election next week raises the chances of Scottish nationalists calling -- and winning -- a vote on independence from the United Kingdom.

Title: Class of COVID-19: Next generation of bankers fear for future
Short Description: It wasn't the introduction to high finance that Adi Patel had once anticipated.

Title: Risk management breakdowns over Archegos in Fed focus -Powell
Short Description: The U.S. Federal Reserve is looking into risk management breakdowns at some of the banks that were involved in the meltdown of New York fund Archegos Capital, the chairman of the central bank said on Wednesday.

Title: Analysis: Grab's Nasdaq debut to test its $40 bln valuation, set roadmap for SPAC hopefuls
Short Description: Singapore's Grab more than doubled its valuation to $40 billion in about a year as part of the world's largest SPAC deal, but maintaining that level after its U.S. debut will be a test not only for investors but also for firms eyeing similar listings.

Title: Banks see 15-35% chance of Scottish independence as key vote nears
Short Description: Investment bank Morgan Stanley has put the chance of Scottish independence from the UK at 15%, while rival Citi put it as high as 35% on Wednesday, as analysts readied for crucial elections next week where the issue will be centrestage.

Title: EXCLUSIVE Salesforce rival Freshworks hires banks for IPO -sources
Short Description: Freshworks Inc, a U.S. maker of business and customer engagement software that competes against Salesforce.com Inc (CRM.N), has hired investment banks to prepare for a U.S. initial public offering (IPO), people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Title: Goldman's digital hedge-fund matchmaking push boosted by lockdowns
Short Description: Goldman Sachs' long-planned online migration of some lucrative prime-brokerage businesses picked up steam during the pandemic as hedge funds and investors working from home were unable to meet in person, while other Wall Street banks are taking more measured steps.

Title: Analysis: U.S. banks’ bond bonanza driven by extraordinary market conditions, regulatory decisions
Short Description: Record-breaking Wall Street bank bond offerings in recent days are being driven by a combination of extraordinary market conditions and regulatory decisions that can be traced to the government's pandemic relief efforts, said analysts.

Title: Saudi Tadawul Group narrows banks for IPO process -sources
Short Description: Saudi Tadawul Group has short-listed three local and three foreign banks for potential advisory roles in the financial market company's upcoming initial public offering (IPO), three sources said.

Title: Carney, Kerry launch global finance plan to boost climate action
Short Description: UN climate envoy Mark Carney and U.S. peer John Kerry on Wednesday announced a new plan to boost efforts by the financial system to help move the global economy to net zero greenhouse gas emissions.

Title: Factbox: Bitcoin’s march to the mainstream gathers pace
Short Description: Bitcoin  hit a record high just shy of $65,000 last week, the latest landmark on the emerging asset's march to wider acceptance. Its gains have been fuelled by growing acceptance among major U.S. companies and financial firms.

Title: Credit Suisse serves investors thin gruel as Wall Street feasts on deals
Short Description: While Wall Street rivals feast off a boom in trading and deals, Credit Suisse is stuck in limbo.

Title: Wall St ends week positively; S&P 500, Dow hit record highs
Short Description: The three main Wall Street indexes ended Friday higher for the day and week, with the S&P 500 (.SPX) and the Dow (.DJI) breaking closing records, as investors took strong economic data and bank earnings as signs of momentum in the U.S. pandemic recovery.

Title: Morgan Stanley picked good time to back bad client
Short Description: In normal times, an investment bank making a $911 million loss on a single client would be a major banana skin, and the firm in question would be wise to disclose it pronto. Fortunately for Morgan Stanley (MS.N), Archegos Capital Management failed in deeply abnormal times. Thanks to a rip-roaring quarter, the effects of backing the wrong client barely registered.

Title: Morgan Stanley reveals $911 million Archegos loss as profit jumps
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N) lost nearly $1 billion from the collapse of family office Archegos Capital Management, the bank said on Friday, muddying its 150% jump in first-quarter profit that was powered by a boom in trading and deal-making.

Title: Morgan Stanley profit more than doubles on dealmaking, trading boom
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N) reported a 150% jump in quarterly profit on Friday, as a global dealmaking boom boosted investment banking and heightened trading activity lifted its institutional securities division.

Title: S&P 500, Dow hit record highs on bank earnings boost
Short Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow hit record highs on Friday after Morgan Stanley wrapped up bumper quarterly earnings reports from big U.S. banks, while optimism about a solid economic rebound put the main indexes on course for weekly gains.

Title: Bank CEOs to testify as U.S. Congress ramps up scrutiny of Wall Street
Short Description: The U.S. Congress will hold hearings next month with the chief executives of major Wall Street banks as Democratic lawmakers step up scrutiny of the role lenders have played in helping struggling Americans recover from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Title: Goldman Sachs profit jumps on record global dealmaking
Short Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS.N) reported a massive jump in first-quarter profit on Wednesday, as Wall Street's biggest investment bank capitalized on record levels of global dealmaking activity.

Title: JPMorgan profits on capital markets in a cash-flush economy
Short Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co's (JPM.N) first-quarter results on Wednesday laid bare the challenge big banks face in this phase of the pandemic, where stimulus programs have left individuals and businesses in good financial shape but so flush with cash that few of them need loans.

Title: Coinbase listing marks latest step in crypto’s march to the mainstream
Short Description: Coinbase Global Inc (COIN.O), the biggest U.S. cryptocurrency exchange, will list on the Nasdaq on Wednesday, marking a milestone in the journey of virtual currencies from niche technology to mainstream asset.

Title: Morgan Stanley aims to support $750 bln in low-carbon investments by 2030
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N) said on Tuesday it would seek to encourage an additional $750 billion worth of spending on low-carbon solutions by 2030 under a scheme which two years ago targeted $250 billion in investment.

Title: HSBC bans customers from buying bitcoin-backer MicroStrategy shares
Short Description: HSBC (HSBA.L) has banned customers of its online share-trading platform from buying or moving into their accounts MicroStrategy Inc (MSTR.O) stock, a message seen by Reuters showed, calling it a "virtual currency product".

Title: Wall St Week Ahead With stocks at record highs, investors look to upcoming earnings
Short Description: Wall Street is kicking off a crucial reporting season as U.S. companies provide quarterly results a year after the coronavirus pandemic crippled the economy and as investors look for reasons to support a stock market at record highs.

Title: S&P 500, Dow at all-time high as banks, industrial rise
Short Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow hit record highs on Friday as economy-linked stocks including banks and industrials gained on optimism around strong U.S. economic growth.

Title: EXCLUSIVE China’s Didi picks Goldman, Morgan Stanley for mega U.S. IPO-sources
Short Description: China's top ride-hailing firm Didi Chuxing has mandated Goldman Sachs (GS.N) and Morgan Stanley (MS.N) to lead its blockbuster IPO and plans to file confidentially for the New York float this month, two people with knowledge of the matter said.

Title: EXCLUSIVE Brazilian payments network Elo picks banks for IPO - sources
Short Description: Brazilian payments firm Elo has chosen six banks to manage its initial public offering, four sources close to the matter said, in the first concrete sign it is proceeding with a move first proposed by shareholders in August.

Title: U.S. Senate Banking chair presses Wall Street banks on Archegos ties
Short Description: The Democratic chair of the U.S. Senate Banking Committee has written to several large banks, including Credit Suisse and Japan's Nomura (8604.T), asking them for information on their relationship with New York-based Archegos Capital Management after the fund imploded last month.

Title: Morgan Stanley hires UBS banker Greco to head Italy financial services M&A - sources
Short Description: Morgan Stanley has hired Emilio Greco from UBS to head financial services M&A in Italy, sources told Reuters, as the country's banking sector braces for a new round of mergers to improve efficiency and boost profitability.

Title: Prosus nets $14.6 billion from sale of Tencent stake
Short Description: Amsterdam-based technology investor Prosus NV (PRX.AS) said on Thursday it netted $14.6 billion from its overnight sale of a 2% stake in Chinese gaming and social media giant Tencent (0700.HK) in one of the world's largest ever block trades.

Title: Morgan Stanley dumped $5 bln in Archegos stock night before fire sale -CNBC
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N) sold about $5 billion of Archegos' stocks the night before the fire sale hit rivals, CNBC reported on Tuesday, citing people with knowledge of the trades.

Title: Archegos-linked stocks slide as markets eye more unwinding
Short Description: Archegos Capital Management’s ill-fated bets weighed on ViacomCBS (VIAC.O), Discovery Inc (DISCA.O) and other media stocks on Monday, and at least one analyst said it remained unclear when banks exposed to the troubled family office would be done selling off their positions in the shares.

Title: Seduced by Archegos’ growth, Nomura took a chance on Hwang comeback
Short Description: U.S. investor Sung Kook "Bill" Hwang was looking for a second chance on Wall Street after falling from grace and shutting his multibillion-dollar hedge fund firm. Japan's Nomura Holdings Inc (8604.T) gave him one.

Title: Morgan Stanley plans to raise dividend when Fed allows -letter
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N) plans to increase the dividend it pays shareholders when restrictions are lifted by the Federal Reserve, according to a letter Chief Executive James Gorman sent to shareholders on Thursday.

Title: Big banks win dismissal of U.S. Treasury rigging litigation
Short Description: A U.S. judge on Wednesday dismissed long-running litigation accusing 10 large banks of conspiring to suppress competition in the now $21.2 trillion market for U.S. Treasury securities.

Title: In Archegos fire sale, Credit Suisse, Nomura burned by slow exit
Short Description: While banks including Goldman Sachs (GS.N), Morgan Stanley (MS.N) and Deutsche Bank (DBKGn.DE) were able to exit their trades with Archegos Capital relatively unscathed, Credit Suisse and Nomura have been burned in the fire sale.

Title: Wall St drops as tech stocks hit by spike in yields
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes slipped on Tuesday as investors pulled out of heavyweight tech-related stocks and flocked to undervalued banks and industrial stocks amid a rise in U.S. bond yields.

Title: Wall St set to open lower as spike in yields pressure tech stocks
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexeswere set to open lower on Tuesday as a rise in U.S. bond yields hit heavyweight tech-related stocks, while undervalued banks and industrial stocks that stand to benefit from a re-opening economy edged higher.

Title: Archegos losses tallied up, industry regulatory scrutiny grows
Short Description: Wall Street counted the cost of the Archegos Capital meltdown on Tuesday, with pressure mounting on heavily exposed Credit Suisse (CSGN.S) and regulators stepping up scrutiny of the fallout from banks' unwinding the New York fund's positions.

Title: S&P 500 ends a hair lower; hedge fund default concerns hit banks
Short Description: The S&P 500 ended just slightly in the red on Monday, with bank shares falling amid warnings of potential losses from a hedge fund's default on margin calls, while optimism over the economy limited the day's declines.

Title: S&P 500 near flat; hedge fund default concerns hit banks
Short Description: The S&P 500 was nearly flat in Monday afternoon trading, with bank shares falling amid warnings of potential losses from a hedge fund's default on margin calls, while optimism over the economy limited the day's declines.

Title: Banks lead Wall Street lower on hedge fund default concerns
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes fell on Monday after a surge in the previous session, as global banks said they faced potential losses of billion of dollars from a hedge fund's default on margin calls.

Title: 3 Archegos margin call share dump ripples across markets
Short Description: Nomura (8604.T) and Credit Suisse (CSGN.S) are facing billions of dollars in losses after a U.S. hedge fund, named by sources as Archegos Capital, defaulted on margin calls, putting investors on edge about who else might have been caught out.

Title: Wall Street set to slip as bank stocks fall on hedge fund default concerns
Short Description: U.S. stock index futures pointed to a lower open for Wall Street on Monday after a surge in the previous session, as global banks said they faced potential losses from a hedge fund's default on margin calls.

Title: Global banks brace for losses from Archegos fallout
Short Description: Global banks may lose more than $6 billion from the downfall of Archegos Capital, sources familiar with trades involving the U.S. investment firm said on Monday, and regulators and investors fear the episode could reverberate more widely.

Title: Large block trades that caused selling raises questions about cause
Short Description: A number of large block trades on Friday which investors said caused big drops in the stocks of a clutch of companies has raised speculation about what was behind them, with Goldman Sachs said to be a bank involved in the sales.  Shares in ViacomCBS and Discovery tumbled around 27% each on Friday, while U.S.-listed shares of China based Baidu and Tencent Music plunged during the week, dropping as much as 33.5% and 48.5%, respectively, from Tuesday's closing levels.

Title: S&P 500, Dow set to open higher on recovery hopes
Short Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow were set to open higher on Friday as investors bought undervalued energy and bank stocks betting on what is expected to be the fastest economic growth since 1984.

Title: Baby boomers next to jump into crypto, Galaxy Digital's Novogratz predicts
Short Description: Wealthy baby boomers will be the next generation to jump into cryptocurrencies as they become more mainstream, potentially bringing billions of dollars to the rallying sector, said Mike Novogratz, founder of crypto firm Galaxy Digital.

Title: U.S. bank profits may leap, then fade, as investors look under the hood
Short Description: Big U.S. banks are on track to produce blockbuster first-quarter profit gains, but enthusiasm might fade when investors look under the hood.

Title: Macquarie bid for Italy's Ital Gas Storage falls short - sources
Short Description: The sale of Italy's biggest independent gas storage facility has stalled after a bid by Australia's Macquarie of more than one billion euros ($1.2 billion) failed to win over owner Morgan Stanley, three sources said.

Title: Reckitt Benckiser considers over $2 bln sale of Mead Johnson Greater China -sources
Short Description: British consumer goods company Reckitt Benckiser Group (RB.L) is considering selling its infant formula business in Greater China, in a deal that could value the business at more than $2 billion, two people with knowledge of the matter said.

Title: Morgan Stanley's PAC resumed donations weeks after Capitol riot pause
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's (MS.N) political action committee (PAC) resumed donations to lawmakers in February, weeks after it had announced a pause following the Capitol riots, according to a federal filing.

Title: Take Five: A trillion-dollar problem
Short Description: 1/ SNB CONUNDRUM

Title: BNY Mellon invests in cryptocurrency storage firm Fireblocks
Short Description: Bank of New York Mellon Corp (BK.N) has invested in Fireblocks, a platform that allows banks and other financial institutes to store, move and issue cryptocurrencies, as the world's largest custodian bank deepens its focus on digital assets.

Title: Morgan Stanley becomes first major U.S. bank to offer clients access to bitcoin funds - CNBC
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N) has become the first big U.S. bank to offer its wealth management clients access to bitcoin funds, CNBC reported on Wednesday.

Title: EXCLUSIVE AbbVie in talks to sell $5 bln women's drugs portfolio - sources
Short Description: U.S. drugmaker AbbVie Inc (ABBV.N) is holding talks to sell a roughly $5 billion portfolio of women's drugs acquired last year through its $63 billion purchase of Botox maker Allergan Plc, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Title: UPDATE 1-Morgan Stanley upbeat on Argentina credit as IMF deal delay priced in
Short Description: Morgan Stanley said it had shifted its long-held neutral view on Argentina sovereign credit to "like," as risks were skewed to the upside after a lot of bad news had been priced into bonds, including, increasingly, a delay to an IMF program.

Title: Commodity price surge leaves emerging currencies adrift
Short Description: Talk of a commodities "super cycle" and gains in prices from iron to copper have brightened the outlook for resource-linked currencies, but the tide hasn't lifted all boats, with emerging market currencies struggling to keep up with developed peers.

Title: Listings boom, trading frenzy fuel record 2020 for investment banks
Short Description: A surge in blank-cheque investment vehicle fundraising and frantic pandemic-related trading in 2020 boosted investment banks' income by a record 28% from the year before, a report showed on Friday.

Title: Analysis: Greensill's funding problems could cause broad ripples
Short Description: A funding crisis at Greensill Capital could spill over to some of its high-risk borrowers and lead to losses for insurers and banks that have done business with the UK-based supply chain finance firm if its clients default, according to several industry experts and a review of public filings.

Title: US STOCKS S&P 500, Nasdaq fall as high-flying tech stocks slide
Short Description: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq fell on Wednesday as investors sold off high-flying technology shares and pivoted to sectors more likely to benefit from an economic recovery on the back of more fiscal stimulus and vaccination programs.

Title: US STOCKS Wall Street retreats after solid start to March
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes dropped on Tuesday after a strong start to March as bond yields pulled back from a one-year high, while investors also looked to cues on progress in the next round of fiscal stimulus.

Title: Analysis: After Brazil ructions, a rethink for investors in emerging market state firms
Short Description: Brazil's shake up of state-run oil firm Petrobras (PETR4.SA) has caused shockwaves at home but may also prompt some bond investors to rethink their $1 trillion-plus exposure to other government-controlled companies across emerging markets.

Title: US STOCKS Nasdaq, S&P set to open lower as tech shares fall amid rising bond yields
Short Description: The Nasdaq and S&P 500 indexes were set to open lower on Thursday as heavyweight technology-related stocks remained under pressure with a rise in U.S. Treasury yields, while data showed weekly jobless claims fell more than expected.

Title: COVID-19 vaccine vial maker Stevanato preps IPO valuing it at up to $5 bln -sources
Short Description: Italy's Stevanato Group, manufacturer of glass vials for COVID-19 vaccines and other healthcare products, is making plans for an initial public offering this year that could value the company at between $4 billion-$5 billion, three sources with knowledge of the situation told Reuters.

Title: Firms' climate data reporting is improving, says Norway wealth fund
Short Description: Companies are improving the way they report about their impact on the climate, Norway's $1.3 trillion sovereign wealth fund said on Thursday, having long called for fuller disclosures.

Title: Swedish pest control group Anticimex plans pre-summer IPO -sources
Short Description: Swedish pest control group Anticimex is finalising preparations for an initial public offering in Stockholm that could value the company at around 63 billion Swedish crowns ($7.60 billion), people close to the matter said.

Title: Dow Inc seeks buyers for German chemical parks infrastructure -sources
Short Description: U.S. chemicals maker Dow Inc (DOW.N) has put German infrastructure assets up for sale in a potential 800 million euro ($966 million) deal as it seeks cash for investment elsewhere, sources close to the matter told Reuters.

Title: Barclays resumes dividend as annual profit halves
Short Description: Barclays (BARC.L) has resumed modest shareholder payouts after a year-long hiatus due to the COVID-19 pandemic, setting expectations other British lenders will follow suit when they report 2020 earnings in the next few days.

Title: Brazil's overwhelmed healthcare system spawns bonanza for dealmakers
Short Description: Brazil's public health system has been pushed to the breaking point by one of the world's deadliest coronavirus outbreaks, but its private healthcare sector is experiencing an unlikely dealmaking boom.

Title: US STOCKS Recovery rally drives S&P 500, Dow to new peaks
Short Description: The S&P 500 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average hit all-time highs on Tuesday as cyclical sectors gained on the prospect of more fiscal aid to lift the U.S. economy from a coronavirus-driven slump.

Title: EXCLUSIVE Montana Aerospace prepares for $1.8 billion stock market listing -sources
Short Description: Austrian-Swiss aircraft parts maker Montana Aerospace is preparing for a $1.8 billion stock market listing as its private equity owner seeks to exit while stock market valuations are high, people close to the matter said.

Title: Performance of funds invested in GameStop in past 2 weeks
Short Description: The Morgan Stanley Institutional Small Co. Inception Portfolio fund  was among the top gainers among mutual funds over the past two weeks having exposure to videogame retailer GameStop (GME.N), data from Refinitiv Lipper showed.

Title: Short seller Kerrisdale goes long on 'The Robinhood of China'
Short Description: Sahm Adrangi, whose Kerrisdale Capital cemented its reputation with successful bets against Chinese internet companies, came out with a long position in Beijing-based UP Fintech Holdings Ltd on Tuesday, calling it "The Robinhood of China."

Title: Vodafone prepares telecom towers business for March IPO -sources
Short Description: Vodafone (VOD.L) plans to float Vantage Towers, its European mobile phone masts business, on the Frankfurt stock exchange in March in a share offering worth about 3 billion euros ($3.6 billion), three people close to the matter said.

Title: China mutual funds draw heavy inflows amid stock frenzy
Short Description: China saw record monthly inflows into new equity and balanced funds in January, as retail investors scramble for exposure to the bullish stock market.

Title: Big step forward for Dr. Martens as shares jump in $5 bln London debut
Short Description: Classic boot brand Dr. Martens  kicked off its London IPO in style on Friday, attracting bumper demand in a sale valuing the company at more than $5 billion that is likely to spur other British companies to follow suit.

Title: Morgan Stanley's E-Trade platform hit by outages- Downdetector
Short Description: Morgan Stanley-owned (MS.N) E-Trade was experiencing problems on its electronic trading platform late on Thursday, according to outage monitoring website Downdetector.com.

Title: Morgan Stanley CEO's annual pay rises by over 20%
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N) Chief Executive James Gorman's annual pay rose by $6 million, or 22%, last year, according to a regulatory filing released on Friday.

Title: US STOCKS Wall Street closes at record highs as Netflix jumps, Biden inaugurated
Short Description: U.S. stocks closed at record highs on Wednesday as Joe Biden was sworn in as the 46th U.S. president, while solid results from Netflix sparked a rally in shares of "stay-at-home" beneficiaries.

Title: US STOCKS Wall Street sets record as Netflix jumps, Biden inaugurated
Short Description: U.S. stocks closed at record highs on Wednesday as Joe Biden was sworn in as the 46th U.S. president, while solid results from Netflix sparked a rally in shares of "stay-at-home" beneficiaries.

Title: US STOCKS S&P 500, Nasdaq scale highs as Netflix jumps, Biden inaugurated
Short Description: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq hit highs on Wednesday as Joe Biden was sworn in as the 46th U.S. president, while solid results from Netflix sparked a rally in shares of stay-at-home winners.

Title: Morgan Stanley boosts targets after blowout trading quarter
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N) boosted both its short and long-term operating targets on Wednesday after coronavirus-induced volatility in financial markets helped the Wall Street bank post a quarterly profit that sailed past estimates.

Title: Morgan Stanley profit surges on trading strength
Short Description: Morgan Stanley (MS.N) posted a 57% rise in fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday, as the Wall Street bank's trading business benefited from coronavirus-induced volatility in financial markets.

Title: US STOCKS S&P 500, Nasdaq scale record highs as Netflix soars; Biden takes office
Short Description: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq hit all-time highs on Wednesday as Joe Biden became the 46th U.S. president, while solid results from Netflix sparked a rally in shares of stay-at-home winners.

Title: Shares climb, dollar dips before Yellen speech; earnings in focus
Short Description: Global shares climbed and the dollar eased on Tuesday before Janet Yellen's Treasury Secretary confirmation speech, in which she is expected to bolster the case for heavy fiscal stimulus in the world's largest economy.

Title: Goldman hints at cost cuts to hit targets as trading gains look ready to slow
Short Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS.N) posted a blockbuster fourth-quarter profit that dwarfed Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, but executives warned that capital markets activity fueling results lately will probably slow down and that the bank's consumer business will take longer to get in the black.

Title: US STOCKS Wall St rises as Yellen speaks; spotlight on earnings
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes rose on Tuesday on positive earnings updates from major U.S. lenders, while Treasury Secretary nominee Janet Yellen advocated for a hefty fiscal relief package before Senate lawmakers to ride out the world's largest economy from a pandemic-driven slump.

Title: JPMorgan trims loan reserves on hopes for recovery
Short Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co (JPM.N) reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit on Friday as it released some of the cash it had built up against coronavirus-driven loan losses, although the bank cautioned that demand for loans was likely to remain sluggish this year.

Title: EXCLUSIVE Goldman eyes deals to boost Marcus-sources
Short Description: Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS.N) is considering acquisitions to bulk up its consumer banking unit Marcus, after the Wall Street firm slowed loan and deposit growth at its fledgling business last year in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic, three bank sources said.

Title: US STOCKS Wall St edges higher with eyes on earnings season; GM soars
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes inched higher on Tuesday ahead of the start of corporate America's reporting season that could signal a rebound in earnings, while General Motors' shares jumped on launching an electric delivery vehicle business.

Title: Analysis: U.S. IPO market faces first big test of 2021
Short Description: At least eight businesses are set to price initial public offerings (IPOs) in New York in the next three days, seeking to raise a total of nearly $5 billion in what could be the biggest week for new listings in more than five years.

Title: Republicans face growing corporate backlash after Capitol assault
Short Description: Republicans in the U.S. Congress faced growing blowback on Monday from businesses that said they would cut off campaign contributions to those who voted last week to challenge President-elect Joe Biden's victory.

Title: MONEY MARKETS Markets fret Fed rate hikes, tapering are coming closer
Short Description: Money markets have ramped up bets on U.S. interest rates rising in 2023, sending a shudder through global equities which may soon have to brace for the day the Federal Reserve starts scaling back aid to the economy.

Title: Dr. Martens set to kick off IPO season with London listing
Short Description: Classic British boot brand Dr. Martens announced its intention to pursue a London stock market listing on Monday, kicking off what is expected to be a brisk start to the year for European initial public offerings (IPOs) after a pandemic-disrupted 2020.

Title: Money markets ramp up bets on U.S. interest rate hikes by 2023
Short Description: Judging by trading in U.S. money markets, investors are starting to ramp up expectations for a rise in U.S. interest rates by the second half of 2023 on the prospects of more fiscal stimulus and higher inflation.

Title: U.S. bank quarterly profits expected to fall again from pre-COVID levels
Short Description: When the biggest U.S. banks begin reporting fourth-quarter results on Friday some of the headlines could show profits plunged by as much as 40% from a year earlier, before the pandemic struck.

Title: MOVES-Morgan Stanley to name private wealth management boss as HR chief
Short Description: Morgan Stanley will name Mandell Crawley, its current head of private wealth management business, as chief human resources officer effective Feb. 1, according to a memo seen by Reuters on Tuesday.

Title: Analysis: New direct listings won't spell the death of IPOs
Short Description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's approval of capital raisings through direct listings will be seized on by some startups, yet most companies will still opt for initial public offerings (IPOs), capital market insiders say.

Title: Big tech bets and cryptocurrencies power 2020's top U.S. funds
Short Description: Outsized bets on large U.S. technology companies and emerging cryptocurrencies fueled the year's top-performing U.S. mutual fund and exchange-traded funds as the coronavirus pandemic upended global markets, while funds that bet on oil and gas companies fell nearly 100%, according to data from fund-tracker Morningstar.

Title: Movie studio behind "James Bond" franchise explores sale - source
Short Description: U.S. movie studio MGM Holdings is exploring a sale, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday.

Title: Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley lead U.S. bank rally after stress test
Short Description: U.S. bank shares outperformed the broader market on Monday, led by Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley, after the Federal Reserve said stress test results meant the sector could resume stock buybacks for the first time since the coronavirus-led downturn.

Title: US STOCKS S&P 500 set for worst day in a month on fresh virus fears
Short Description: The S&P 500 was set for its worst day in a month on Monday as a more-virulent strain of the coronavirus in Britain sparked fears of fresh disruptions and offset optimism over a coronavirus aid package.

Title: US STOCKS Wall Street set to drop on fears over new coronavirus strain
Short Description: Wall Street's main indexes were set to fall from record levels on Monday, with travel stocks leading declines, as concerns over a new strain of the coronavirus in Britain prompted investors to lock in profits.

Title: US STOCKS S&P 500, Nasdaq at record highs as stimulus bets offset higher jobless claims
Short Description: Technology shares pushed the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq to record highs on Thursday as optimism grew over a coronavirus stimulus bill, helping markets look past signs of economic strain brought on by the COVID-19 pandemic.

Title: Factbox: What's new with the Fed's 2020 bank stress tests?
Short Description: The Federal Reserve's bank stress tests have been significantly different in 2020, thanks to regulatory changes and the dramatic economic turmoil brought on by coronavirus pandemic.

Title: New Jersey partners with Morgan Stanley to attract diverse entrepreneurs
Short Description: The New Jersey Economic Development Authority (NJEDA) on Tuesday said it has tapped Morgan Stanley's (MS.N) Multicultural Innovation Lab as the first participant in its initiative aimed at getting more startups headquartered in the state.

Title: Analysis: Amateur traders' euphoria leaves red-hot U.S. IPOs with money on the table
Short Description: Wild stock gains on the first day of trading of Airbnb Inc (ABNB.O) and DoorDash Inc (DASH.N) show how unprecedented demand this year from individual investors is making it difficult not to leave big money on the table, investment bankers say.

Title: Brexit: Morgan Stanley sees FTSE 250 down as much as 10% on no deal
Short Description: Morgan Stanley said on Friday that it expects the FTSE 250 index to drop 6% to 10% if Britain fails to agree a trade deal with the European Union before the end of a transition period.

Title: Airbnb prices shares above target in 2020's biggest U.S. IPO -source
Short Description: Airbnb Inc (ABNB.O) on Wednesday sold shares in its initial public offering (IPO) on Wednesday at $68 apiece, above its targeted price range, to raise around $3.5 billion, according to a person familiar with the matter.

Title: Morgan Stanley fires two senior commodities executives after rule breach - Bloomberg News
Short Description: Morgan Stanley has fired two of its most senior commodities executives after discovering they used unauthorized electronic means of communication, Bloomberg News reported https://bit.ly/3j9i8UI on Tuesday, citing two people familiar with the matter.

Title: Morgan Stanley Q3 profit jumps 26% on trading boost
Short Description: Morgan Stanley posted a 26% jump in third-quarter profit on Thursday, powered by another bumper quarter at its trading business as the COVID-19 pandemic drove up volatility in financial markets.

Title: Morgan Stanley doesn't expect Q2 trading boom to continue
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's Chief Financial Officer Jonathan Pruzan said on Wednesday the bank doesn't expect its sales and trading and investment banking business to perform as well in the third quarter as it had in the second.

Title: Morgan Stanley profit jumps 45% on trading boom
Short Description: Morgan Stanley posted a 45% rise in quarterly profit on Thursday, driven by strong trading gains as the coronavirus pandemic whipsawed global financial markets since March.

Title: UPDATE 2-Morgan Stanley launches wealth management business in Canada
Short Description: Morgan Stanley said on Wednesday that it was launching a new international branch of its wealth management business in Canada, marking the U.S. bank's entry into a market that has been seeing intense domestic competition.

Title: Morgan Stanley settles SEC charges it misled clients, to pay $5 mln penalty
Short Description: A unit of Morgan Stanley will pay a $5 million penalty to settle U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission charges it provided misleading information to clients in its retail wrap fee programs regarding trade execution services and transaction costs, the regulator said on...

Title: UPDATE 3-Morgan Stanley profit plunges, warns of more pain ahead
Short Description: Morgan Stanley Chief Executive Officer James Gorman warned that the bank would take "longer to achieve" its medium-term financial targets due to the coronavirus crisis, after its first-quarter profit slumped by 30%.

Title: Morgan Stanley profit plunges 32% on COVID-19 impact
Short Description: Morgan Stanley posted a 32% fall in quarterly profit on Thursday as its advisory and wealth management businesses took a hit from the economic fallout of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Title: Morgan Stanley receives approval for majority stake in China venture - sources
Short Description: Morgan Stanley has received regulatory approval to take a majority stake in its China securities joint venture, people with knowledge of the matter said, as Beijing opens up the financial sector to foreigners.

Title: Morgan Stanley online platform for wealthy clients down
Short Description: Morgan Stanley said in a recorded message on Wednesday that its online trading platform and website tools for wealth management clients were down.

Title: MOVES-Morgan Stanley hires new deputy CFO, Raja Akram, from Citi
Short Description: Morgan Stanley said on Thursday it hired Raja Akram to be its next deputy chief financial officer from rival bank Citigroup Inc, according to regulatory filings.

Title: Morgan Stanley conference-goers asked to self-report coronavirus exposure
Short Description: Morgan Stanley is asking anyone who is attending its technology, media and telecom conference in California next week to report if they have visited several countries that have reported coronavirus cases in recent weeks.

Title: Morgan Stanley donates $20 mln to children's mental health programs
Short Description: Morgan Stanley said on Monday it will give $20 million to seven nonprofit groups working to prevent youth suicide and fight depression and other children's mental health problems.

Title: MOVES-Morgan Stanley executive Rich Portogallo to retire - memo
Short Description: Veteran Morgan Stanley executive Rich Portogallo, who played a key role in building the bank's prime-brokerage business, is retiring, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.

Title: Morgan Stanley CEO Gorman's total 2019 pay falls 7% to $27 million
Short Description: Morgan Stanley said on Friday that its board lowered Chief Executive Officer James Gorman's total compensation for 2019 to $27 million, from $29 million in 2018, according to regulatory filings.

Title: Morgan Stanley profit surges 53%
Short Description: Morgan Stanley reported a 53% rise in quarterly profit on Thursday, driven by strength in its bond trading and underwriting businesses.

Title: MOVES-Morgan Stanley replaces North America head of macro trading - Bloomberg
Short Description: Morgan Stanley has replaced the head of its macro trading business for North America, Bloomberg reported on Thursday citing an internal memo.

Short Description: * MORGAN STANLEY PLANS TO BOOST JUNIOR BANKER PAY AS MUCH AS 25 PERCENT - BLOOMBERG, CITING SOURCES Source text: https://bloom.bg/2raLHMR Further company coverage:

Title: Morgan Stanley to seek new court for Italian derivatives case -sources
Short Description: Morgan Stanley on Thursday will seek to have a suit against it for 2.7 billion euros ($3.34 billion) in damages thrown out of an Italian administrative court, three sources close to the case told Reuters.

Short Description: * REPORTED NET REVENUES OF $11.1 BILLION FOR Q1 ENDED MARCH 31, 2018 COMPARED WITH $9.7 BILLION

Short Description: Morgan Stanley Chief Executive James Gorman's overall pay rose 20 percent to $27 million in 2017, according to bank filings released on Friday.

Title: Morgan Stanley names Asia banker as global co-head of consumer retail i-banking -memo
Short Description: Morgan Stanley on Tuesday named its senior Asia dealmaker David Aronovitch as global co-head of consumer retail investment banking, who will share the coverage responsibility with David Ciagne and Ben Frost, as per an internal memo seen by Reuters.

Title: BRIEF-Morgan Stanley CFO Pruzan Granted 31,691.39 Restricted Stock Units As Part Of 2017 Year-End Compensation
Short Description: * MORGAN STANLEY - CFO JONATHAN PRUZAN GRANTED 31,691.39 RESTRICTED STOCK UNITS IN 2018 AS PART OF 2017 YEAR-END COMPENSATION - SEC FILING

Title: MOVES-Morgan Stanley banker Antakly leaves to join PJT Partners
Short Description: Boutique investment bank PJT Partners Inc has added another former Morgan Stanley managing director, Michel Antakly, to its growing stable of senior advisors in London, a source familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

Title: MOVES-Morgan Stanley hires ex-JPMorgan exec as new CEO of Saudi office
Short Description: Morgan Stanley named a new chief executive of its office in Saudi Arabia on Monday, as the firm carries out work on high-profile deals like the initial public offering of state oil giant Aramco.

Title: BRIEF-Morgan Stanley announces share repurchase of up to $5 billion of common stock
Short Description: * Morgan Stanley announces share repurchase of up to $5 billion of common stock and the increase of its quarterly dividend to $0.25 per share

Title: CORRECTED-MOVES-Brennan heads to Morgan Stanley syndicate
Short Description: Morgan Stanley has hired Nicholas Brennan from Societe Generale to work on its European fixed income syndicate desk, according to market sources.

Title: Morgan Stanley CEO says Saudi Arabia could be 'major opportunity'
Short Description: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman said Saudi Arabia could be a "major opportunity" for the firm as the country unveiled plans for oil giant Saudi Aramco's $100 billion initial public offering and introduced a series of reforms to attract foreign capital in 2015.

Title: Morgan Stanley shareholders approve executive compensation plan
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's executive compensation plan received the support of over 90 percent of its shareholders at the bank's annual meeting in its Purchase, New York wealth management headquarters on Monday.

Title: MOVES-Morgan Stanley technology executive Hickson leaves for fintech company
Short Description: Euroloan Group Plc hired Morgan Stanley's James Hickson as group president, the Helsinki-based financial technology company said on Thursday.

Title: MOVES-Klaus Kleinfeld resigns from Morgan Stanley board -filing
Short Description: Klaus Kleinfeld has resigned from Morgan Stanley's board, effective immediately, and will not stand for election at its annual meeting, the Wall Street bank said in a filing on Friday.

Title: Morgan Stanley shareholders propose policy against golden parachute for execs entering govt service
Short Description: Morgan Stanley shareholders will again vote on a proposal that prohibits stock awards from vesting for bank executives who resign for government service.

Title: REFILE-UPDATE 1-MOVES-Morgan Stanley's Harris reshuffles DCM
Short Description: Morgan Stanley has launched a senior coverage group in its Europe, Middle East and Africa fixed income capital markets business, which will be headed by former financial institutions group co-head Cecile Hillary.

Title: MOVES-Hillary promoted in further DCM changes at Morgan Stanley
Short Description: Morgan Stanley has launched a senior coverage group in its Europe, Middle East and Africa fixed income capital markets business, which will be headed up by former financial institutions group co-head Cecile Hillary.

Title: BRIEF-Morgan Stanley said to move about 300 workers to Frankfurt or Dublin - Bloomberg, citing sources
Short Description: * Morgan Stanley said to move about 300 workers to Frankfurt or Dublin - Bloomberg, citing sources Source text for Eikon: [ID:http://bloom.bg/2lu41i3] Further company coverage:

Title: UPDATE 1-MOVES-Morgan Stanley's global stock trading head leaves for hedge fund Millennium
Short Description: Morgan Stanley said on Tuesday its global head of equities trading, Peter Santoro, is leaving the firm.

Title: MOVES-Morgan Stanley's global stock trading head leaves for hedge fund Millennium
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's global head of equities trading Peter Santoro is leaving the firm, the company said on Tuesday.

Title: Morgan Stanley to pay $8 mln to settle U.S. SEC charges
Short Description: Morgan Stanley has agreed to pay $8 million dollars to settle charges related to single inverse ETF investments that the firm had recommended to clients, U.S. financial regulators said on Tuesday.

Title: SEC fines Citigroup, Morgan Stanley over forex trading program
Short Description: Citigroup Inc and Morgan Stanley each agreed to pay more than $2.96 million to settle charges they misled investors about a foreign exchange trading program they were selling, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said on Tuesday.

Title: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman sees pay increase 7 percent to $22.5m
Short Description: Morgan Stanley Chief Executive Officer James Gorman's overall pay rose 7 percent in 2016 to $22.5 million, according to a securities filing.

Title: MOVES- Morgan Stanley promotes Civitillo
Short Description: Morgan Stanley has promoted Leo Civitillo to global head of fixed-income capital markets, according to an internal memo seen by IFR on Wednesday.

Title: Morgan Stanley inked deals with 10 digital partners in 2016 -CEO
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's Chief Executive James Gorman said the bank's wealth management business finalized new alliances with 10 digital partners in 2016, during a call on Tuesday with analysts to discuss fourth-quarter earnings.

Title: Morgan Stanley to pay $13 mln for overbilling clients: SEC
Short Description: Morgan Stanley will pay $13 million to settle civil charges, after it overbilled some of its wealth management clients because of coding and other billing system errors, U.S. regulators said Friday.

Title: Morgan Stanley to pay $13 mln for overbilling clients, SEC says
Short Description: Morgan Stanley will pay $13 million to settle civil charges that it overbilled some of its wealth management clients because of coding and other billing system errors, U.S. regulators said Friday.

Title: Morgan Stanley's international wealth head Jesse departs -spokeswoman
Short Description: The head of Morgan Stanley's international wealth management team, James Jesse, has left the firm, a spokeswoman said on Friday.

Title: Morgan Stanley to pay $7.5 mln over customer protection violations
Short Description: Morgan Stanley will pay $7.5 million to settle civil charges that it violated customer protection rules when it used trades involving customer cash to lower its borrowing costs, U.S. securities regulators said on Tuesday.

Title: Morgan Stanley execs earn $10.5 mln in post-election rally
Short Description: Senior Morgan Stanley executives collectively earned about $10.5 million over the past week by exercising options and selling shares, with most of them profiting from an election-fueled rally in bank stocks, according to securities filings.

Title: Morgan Stanley begins layoffs in credit division -sources
Short Description: Morgan Stanley this week cut staff covering short-term credit and regional broker-dealers, after a quarter in which the bank posted a 42 percent drop in bond trading, several sources told Reuters.

Title: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Morgan Stanley boosts CEO pay to $16 mln in 2014 -filing
Short Description: Morgan Stanley's board boosted Chairman and Chief Executive James Gorman's compensation by one-third last year, saying the bank's performance was "strong" but had "room for continued progress," according to its proxy filing on Wednesday.

Title: UPDATE 1-Morgan Stanley to defer less of employees' future bonuses
Short Description: Morgan Stanley said on Friday it will pay more of its bonuses to employees upfront and defer less, because the bank is on a better financial footing and can move its pay practices more in line with those of competitors.
